comments:
Clicking on Help -> Help Contents does nothing for me in Eclipse 3.1 release 
on GTK.  I haven't yet tried this on any other platform.

This works fine on Windows for me.  Also, I forgot to mention that there was 
nothing in the error log on linux.

I just tried on my Linux machine and "works for me". An "external" Mozilla
browser comes up with http://127.0..0.1:51191/help/index.jsp
in the address bar. 

Could it be sensitive to installed browsers? internet settings?

And ... I'll agree, if it can not provide the help, some message would be
appropriate, even if not "configured" correctly

I'll say sensitive, I tried clicking on something after that initial screen came
up and my Mozilla (version 1.4.3) "froze" and I had to kill the process. 

Switching to the newer firefox solved that problem.

I am using SUSE 9.0 which has the Konqueror 3.1.4 web browser (which is Mozilla 
5.0 compatible), and not Firefox. 
 
I reverted to 3.1M7 to see if I could reproduce the problem in there, and it 
gave me the following stack trace:

I changed the Help preferences to use the external browser (Konqueror) instead 
of the default system one, and it worked fine.

I had this problem running Eclipse 3.1.1 on Linux. Unsetting my CLASSPATH fixed
it completely.
Is this still a problem and if so, should the severity stay at 'critical'?
Sending to Platform UA inbox, either because owner is incorrect or no longer works on UA.

Nobody has commented on this in over a year and nobody every responded to Dejan's question in comment 7. My suspicion is that this isn't happening with any relatively recent version of Firefox/Eclipse.

I think we should close it.

traces.message: No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path  (MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]
